attributes.additional_details:
The CSA 1 (TC) form completed under the guidelines of the Child Support Act 1991 iniates all subsequent documentation to a father regarding CSA payments.

The Child Support Act 1991 section 6 (1a) "a- fails to comply with a requirement imposed on her by the Secretary of State under section 6(1)"

If a mother deliberately or unwillingly issues, incorrect or fraudulent information on the CSA 1 (TC) she can not be held accountable, as this form falls outside the remit of the CSA & Secretary of State.

Therefore the precedent of law now being set for the Secretary of State has to intervene with enforcement powers.

Therefore nulifying his right in subsequent documents issued to fathers to subject said fathers to;
a) Charges on Property      b) Loss of Driving Licence c) Loss of Passport           d) Liability Orders          e) Jail or Suspended Sentences (Criminal Conviction)

Should the Government now abolish enforcement action against fathers in light of this?
